message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper proposes a supervised approach to learning statistical semantic relatedness models from subjectively annotated training examples. The paper focuses on natural language processing and information retrieval, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of machine learning algorithms, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the use of a large background knowledge corpus and the fitting of semantic models for specific users or groups of users, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.DL (Deep Learning) sub-category.
